titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Jackson

name.namePart: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Jackson
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 65 motion to reduce sentence pursuant to crack cocaine Amendment 706 as to Wilbur L. Jackson (1). The defendant's previously imposed sentence of imprisonment (as reflected in the last judgment issued) of 135 months is reduced to 120 months. Except as provided above, all provisions of the judgment dated February 11, 2000 shall remain in effect. The Defendant shall be released immediately. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(MKR)

The defendant's previously imposed sentence of imprisonment (as reflected in the last judgment issued) of 135 months is reduced to 120 months. Except as provided above, all provisions of the judgment dated February 11, 2000 shall remain in effect. The Defendant shall be released immediately. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(MKR)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Jackson
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - A Final Violation of Supervised Release Hearing regarding Petition for Offender Under Supervision 72 78 is set for 11/17/2008 11:30 AM in Courtroom 2 - Omaha before Judge Laurie Smith Camp, as to defendant Wilbur L. Jackson. The defendant is to be released on current conditions of supervision once an ankle bracelet becomes available. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (1 Certified copy to USM)(JAE, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:99-cr-00050; United States of America v. Jackson;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - A Final Violation of Supervised Release Hearing regarding Petition for Offender Under Supervision 72 78 is set for 11/17/2008 11:30 AM in Courtroom 2 - Omaha before Judge Laurie Smith Camp, as to defendant Wilbur L. Jackson. The defendant is to be released on current conditions of supervision once an ankle bracelet becomes available. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (1 Certified copy to USM)(JAE, )

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Jackson
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT (For Revocation of Probation or Supervised Release) as to Wilbur L. Jackson. The defendant admitted guilt to allegation 3 of the Petition for Offender Under Supervision 78 and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for time served. Supervised Release of 5 years with special conditions. The defendant shall pay the special assessment in the amount of $100.00. Allegations 1 and 2 of the petition are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only as to defendant Wilbur L. Jackson. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (1 Certified copy to USM)(KBJ)
